stories.title: Beware of scams involving fake correspondence from Europol

stories.text:
Something odd going on with network routing to Twitter in the UK right now. From a BT Broadband home connection, traffic seems to be flowing via an "mts-internet.net" addresses listed in Moscow. I've tried from a VPN and can access Twitter just fine. Downdectector shows a peak in reports of issues too - https://downdetector.co.uk/status/twitter/.

Tracing route to twitter.com [104.244.42.1] over a maximum of 30 hops:

  1    <1 ms    <1 ms    <1 ms  192.168.0.1
  2    <1 ms    <1 ms     1 ms  172.16.10.74
  3     *        *        *     Request timed out.
  4     6 ms     6 ms     6 ms  31.55.186.180
  5     6 ms     6 ms     6 ms  213.121.192.150
  6    18 ms     9 ms     5 ms  peer2-et0-1-7.slough.ukcore.bt.net [62.6.201.53]
  7     5 ms     6 ms     5 ms  mil-cr01-te6-2.lnd.stream-internet.net [195.66.224.218]
  8    19 ms    19 ms    18 ms  anc-cr01-be5.204.ff.mts-internet.net [195.34.53.225]
  9     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 10    54 ms    53 ms    53 ms  a433-cr02-be2.77.msk.mts-internet.net [212.188.28.150]
 11    54 ms    54 ms    55 ms  m9-cr03-ae11.77.msk.mts-internet.net [212.188.42.125]
 12    55 ms    55 ms    54 ms  a433-cr02-be11.77.msk.mts-internet.net [212.188.42.126]
 13     *        *        *     Request timed out.
[...]
stories.title: Twitter Routing Issue in UK?

stories.text:
I'm a front-end developer looking to change careers. I work on a marketing team, and I'm not happy with my job anymore. Marketing is boring (to me) and the lack of any data-driven strategy on the part of my org seems like a waste of resources. I also feel like I'm stagnating intellectually as a result of investing so much of my daily energy into the field of Marketing.

Lately I've become absolutely fascinated by the field of data visualization. I'm extremely comfortable working with D3 and React, so I think pivoting into data visualization will a) make me much more hireable and b) be something I actually enjoy doing that can make a meaningful impact on people.

Can anyone recommend any resources, certificates, or keywords I can use to help my portfolio and résumé stand out in the data visualization field?

Is it possible to get hired as a data viz engineer without a degree in data visualization? I'm currently building out my portfolio with a bunch of interactive visualzations to help support my résumé, but my BA is in the humanities.

Does anyone have any tips on self-education resources for the data viz field?
stories.title: How can I transform myself from a front-end developer to a data viz engineer?
